    heading: "Introduction",
    introText: "I made this portfolio to display the projects I worked on during my sixth semester of ICT and Media Design. The main purpose of this portfolio is to showcase the projects I worked on, both as part of a team and on my own, during the semester six in ICT and Media Design. Feel free to explore and learn more about my work. You'll see the whole process of how I designed and developed this portfolio.",

    introText: "During the early stage of this project, my primary objective was to develop the main research question and its sub-questions. Additionally, they advised me to employ CMD methods to address these questions effectively.",
    researchquestionHeading: "Main research question and subquestions",
    mainQuestion: "How can front-end developers create an effective portfolio that stands out in a competitive job market?",
    subQuestion1: "What are the fundamental principles of portfolio design and development for front-end developers?",

    subQuestion3: "How can front-end developers use their portfolio to stand out in a competitive job market?",

    why: "I chose to do a literature study because I want to find answers and understand the basic principles of portfolio design. This study method lets me explore different viewpoints and learn from experts who have studied portfolio design in depth.",
    resultHeading: "Result: ",
    results: "A front-end developers should build portfolios with clear objectives, simplicity, user-friendliness in showcasing work, mindful technology choices, easy contact access, and the influence of testimonials. By following these principles, developers can create compelling portfolios that effectively communicate their skills and attract potential clients."

    question2: "2. How can front-end developers use portfolio design and development to showcase their skills and work experience?",
    subHeading: "Methods:",
    methods: "Competitive analysis",

Seamless navigation ensures easy exploration, leaving a strong impression on potential employers."

sourcesContent:
const individualProjectData = {
  group1: {
    heading: "Portfolio",
    subHeading: "Semester6 Media Design - Individual Project",
  },
  group2: {
    heading: "Introduction",
    introText:
      "I made this portfolio to display the projects I worked on during my sixth semester of ICT and Media Design. It's an important tool for me as I search for internships and full-time job opportunities later in the future. The main purpose of this portfolio is to showcase the projects I worked on, both as part of a team and on my own, during the semester six in ICT and Media Design. Feel free to explore and learn more about my work. You'll see the whole process of how I designed and developed this portfolio.",
    subHeading: "Initial phase",
  },
  group3: {
    introText:
      "During the early stage of this project, my primary objective was to develop the main research question and its sub-questions. After formulating them, I sought feedback from my semester guides. They provided me with valuable suggestions, including the need to make the research question more specific and reduce the number of questions due to time limitations. Additionally, they advised me to employ CMD methods to address these questions effectively.",
    researchquestionHeading: "Main research question and subquestions",
    mainQuestion:
      "How can front-end developers create an effective portfolio that stands out in a competitive job market?",
    subQuestion1:
      "What are the fundamental principles of portfolio design and development for front-end developers?",
    subQuestion2:
      "How can front-end developers use portfolio design and development to showcase their skills and work experience?",
    subQuestion3:
      "How can front-end developers use their portfolio to stand out in a competitive job market?",
    resultsHeading: "Results",

    question1:
      "1. What are the fundamental principles of portfolio design and development for front-end developers?",
    subHeading: "Methods:",
    methods: "Literature study",
    text: "",
    subheadingWhy: "Why:",
    why: "I chose to do a literature study because I want to find answers and understand the basic principles of portfolio design. By reading articles, and research papers, I hope to gather information, guidance, and best practices in this field. This study method lets me explore different viewpoints and learn from experts who have studied portfolio design in depth.",
    resultHeading: "Result: ",
    results:
      "A front-end developers should build portfolios with clear objectives, simplicity, user-friendliness in showcasing work, mindful technology choices, easy contact access, and the influence of testimonials. By following these principles, developers can create compelling portfolios that effectively communicate their skills and attract potential clients.",
  },

  questionGroup2: {
    question2:
      "2. How can front-end developers use portfolio design and development to showcase their skills and work experience?",
    subHeading: "Methods:",
    methods: "Competitive analysis",
    text: "",
    subheadingWhy: "Why:",
    why: "I chose trend analysis to gain a competitive edge by identifying strengths and weaknesses in other developers' portfolios and staying updated with the latest developments.",
    resultHeading: "Result: ",
    results:
      "A Front-end developers can utilize portfolios to showcase their skills and work experience. They should focus on clean designs that highlight their expertise. Interactive elements and diverse fonts engage visitors, while clear project descriptions provide insights into their development process. Seamless navigation ensures easy exploration, leaving a strong impression on potential employers.",
  },

  questionGroup3: {
    question3:
      "3. How can front-end developers use their portfolio to stand out in a competitive job market?",
    subHeading: "Methods:",
    methods: "Expert Interview ",
    text: "",
    subheadingWhy: "Why:",
    why: "I choose expert interviews because they inform me about industry expectations, provide guidance in a new field, and help me avoid common pitfalls.",
    resultHeading: "Result: ",
    results:
      "In conclusion, making a standout portfolio means combining good design and development, choosing the right content strategically, and using effective strategies to make myself stand out. By following these principles, I can showcase my skills, experience, and personal brand in an interesting way. This will increase my chances of making a good impression on potential employers.",
  },

  secondPhaseHeading: "Second Phase",

  secondPhase: {
    question:
      "3. How can front-end developers use their portfolio to stand out in a competitive job market?",
    subHeading: "Methods:",
    methods: "Expert Interview ",
    text: "",
    subheadingWhy: "Why:",
    why: "I choose expert interviews because they inform me about industry expectations, provide guidance in a new field, and help me avoid common pitfalls.",
    resultHeading: "Result: ",
    results:
      "In conclusion, making a standout portfolio means combining good design and development, choosing the right content strategically, and using effective strategies to make myself stand out. By following these principles, I can showcase my skills, experience, and personal brand in an interesting way. This will increase my chances of making a good impression on potential employers.",
    image: "../assets/images/prototypeimage.png  ",
  },
  // Add more question objects as needed
};

export default individualProjectData;
